references.reason: This paper is foundational for the application of differential privacy to deep learning, a significant motivation for this paper's work on privately estimating subspaces.

references.paper_title: Analyze gauss: Optimal bounds for privacy-preserving principal component analysis
references.reason: This paper provides fundamental lower bounds for private subspace estimation, which motivates the search for settings with improved accuracy.
This paper introduces the concept of multiplicative singular value gaps as a measure of "easiness", which forms a key concept in this paper's approach to quantifying easiness.

references.paper_title: Smooth lower bounds for differentially private algorithms via padding-and-permuting fingerprinting codes
references.reason: This paper provides a novel framework for proving lower bounds in differential privacy, which is used in this paper to establish lower bounds on subspace estimation.
This paper provides a practical differentially private averaging algorithm used in this paper's subspace estimation algorithm, demonstrating its efficacy in high-dimensional settings.
